verses.verse: To every thing there is a season<WH2165>, and a time<WH6256> to every purpose<WH2656> under the heaven<WH8064>:
A time<WH6256> to be born<WH3205>, and a time<WH6256> to die<WH4191>; a time<WH6256> to plant<WH5193>, and a time<WH6256> to pluck up<WH6131> that which is planted<WH5193>; to be: Heb. to bear
A time<WH6256> to kill<WH2026>, and a time<WH6256> to heal<WH7495>; a time<WH6256> to break down<WH6555>, and a time<WH6256> to build up<WH1129>;
A time<WH6256> to weep<WH1058>, and a time<WH6256> to laugh<WH7832>; a time<WH6256> to mourn<WH5594>, and a time<WH6256> to dance<WH7540>;

A time<WH6256> to cast away<WH7993> stones<WH68>, and a time<WH6256> to gather<WH3664> stones<WH68> together<WH3664>; a time<WH6256> to embrace<WH2263>, and a time<WH6256> to refrain<WH7368> from embracing<WH2263>; to refrain from: Heb. to be far from
A time<WH6256> to get<WH1245>, and a time<WH6256> to lose<WH6>; a time<WH6256> to keep<WH8104>, and a time<WH6256> to cast away<WH7993>; get: or, seek
A time<WH6256> to rend<WH7167>, and a time<WH6256> to sew<WH8609>; a time<WH6256> to keep silence<WH2814>, and a time<WH6256> to speak<WH1696>;
A time<WH6256> to love<WH157>, and a time<WH6256> to hate<WH8130>; a time<WH6256> of war<WH4421>, and a time<WH6256> of peace<WH7965>.
What profit<WH3504> hath he that worketh<WH6213> in that wherein<WH834> he laboureth<WH6001>?
I have seen<WH7200> the travail<WH6045>, which God<WH430> hath given<WH5414> to the sons<WH1121> of men<WH120> to be exercised<WH6031> in it.

He hath made<WH6213> every thing beautiful<WH3303> in his time<WH6256>: also he hath set<WH5414> the world<WH5769> in their heart<WH3820>, so that<WH1097> no man<WH120> can find out<WH4672> the work<WH4639> that God<WH430> maketh<WH6213> from the beginning<WH7218> to the end<WH5490>.
I know<WH3045> that there is no good<WH2896> in them, but for a man to rejoice<WH8055>, and to do<WH6213> good<WH2896> in his life<WH2416>.
And also that every man<WH120> should eat<WH398> and drink<WH8354>, and enjoy<WH7200> the good<WH2896> of all his labour<WH5999>, it is the gift<WH4991> of God<WH430>.

I know<WH3045> that, whatsoever God<WH430> doeth<WH6213>, it shall be for ever<WH5769>: nothing<WH369> can be put<WH3254> to it, nor any thing taken<WH1639> from it: and God<WH430> doeth<WH6213> it, that men should fear<WH3372> before<WH6440> him.
That which hath been is now<WH3528>; and that which is to be hath already<WH3528> been; and God<WH430> requireth<WH1245> that which is past<WH7291>. that which is past: Heb. that which is driven away

And moreover I saw<WH7200> under the sun<WH8121> the place<WH4725> of judgment<WH4941>, that wickedness<WH7562> was there; and the place<WH4725> of righteousness<WH6664>, that iniquity<WH7562> was there.

I said<WH559> in mine heart<WH3820>, God<WH430> shall judge<WH8199> the righteous<WH6662> and the wicked<WH7563>: for there is a time<WH6256> there for every purpose<WH2656> and for every work<WH4639>.

I said<WH559> in mine heart<WH3820> concerning the estate<WH1700> of the sons<WH1121> of men<WH120>, that God<WH430> might manifest<WH1305> them, and that they might see<WH7200> that they<WH1992> themselves are beasts<WH929>. that God: or, that they might clear God, and see, etc

For that which befalleth<WH4745> the sons<WH1121> of men<WH120> befalleth<WH4745> beasts<WH929>; even one thing<WH259> befalleth<WH4745> them: as the one dieth<WH4194>, so dieth<WH4194> the other<WH2088>; yea, they have all one<WH259> breath<WH7307>; so that a man<WH120> hath no preeminence<WH4195> above a beast<WH929>: for all is vanity<WH1892>.
All go<WH1980> unto one<WH259> place<WH4725>; all are of the dust<WH6083>, and all turn<WH7725> to dust<WH6083> again<WH7725>.

Who knoweth<WH3045> the spirit<WH7307> of man<WH1121> <WH120> that goeth<WH5927> upward<WH4605>, and the spirit<WH7307> of the beast<WH929> that goeth<WH3381> downward<WH4295> to the earth<WH776>? of man: Heb. of the sons of man goeth upward: Heb. is ascending, etc

Wherefore I perceive<WH7200> that there is nothing better<WH2896>, than that a man<WH120> should rejoice<WH8055> in his own works<WH4639>; for that is his portion<WH2506>: for who shall bring<WH935> him to see<WH7200> what shall be after<WH310> him?
